entry.title: Re: Deactive console SAML login for CDC
entry.content:
Dear Team,

 

In order to deactivate console SAML login for your Partner ID, you need to delete console SAML settings and save it as empty.

You need to go to the Console --> Administration -- > Federated Console Login.

 

Please note that users, who are logged in via Console SAML Login, do not have access to their User Key and User Secret from the Account section of the Console.

All identities created via SAML are unique and not associated with any existing Console User, even if the email address is the same.

 

Best Regards,

SAP

entry.title: Re: Regarding Document Splitting activation
entry.content:
As of SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2408, the Profit Center characteristic can be changed only if no journal entries exist in the production system. It should be noted that only the Mandatory check box can be selected. The Zero Balance check box will automatically be selected upon saving changes. Additionally, customer fields in document splitting are not supported.

For more details please refer to below KBA:

2868475 - SSCUI 102322: Define Document Splitting Characteristics for General Ledger - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Restrict only ‚ÄúUnblock for Payment‚Äù in Manage Supplie...
entry.content:
Dear Sandeep,

unfortunately, there is currently no way to achieve this segregation of permissions you described.

Here's an explanation from a related SAP Note: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3524950

The authorization can be granted only on a higher level. For example, you can grant change authorization for journal entries by Company Code. There is no restriction type which would allow such a fine-granular access control such as on the level of the item payment block or even the level like "remove item payment block A".

Best wishes
Christina

entry.title: SAP Signavio November 2025 Product Release Process Governance
entry.content:
As part of the SAP Signavio November 2025 Product Release, we‚Äôre excited to introduce new SAP Signavio Process Governance capabilities that make it easier for everyone involved in your workflows ‚Äî from administrators and modelers to end users and process participants ‚Äî to collaborate and operate more efficiently.

These updates will roll out in two release waves during November and focus on improving visibility, usability, and automation across your daily governance tasks.

  • Wave 1 ‚Äì November 4, 2025
    • Embedding workflow tasks into the suite task overview
    • Improvement of pagination consistency
  • Wave 2 ‚Äì November 25, 2025
    • Workflow action: Microsoft SharePoint ‚Äì Copy file
    • Workflow action: Creating a new Jira issue
    • Workflow action: Adding a new comment to the Jira issue
    • Zoom in and out of workflows with ease in the editor

Together, these enhancements help you streamline how work gets done ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre managing tasks, modeling workflows, or enabling automation through integrations with tools like Microsoft SharePoint and Jira.

Let‚Äôs take a closer look at what‚Äôs new.

Wave 1 ‚Äì November 4, 2025

Work more efficiently with all tasks in one view

With the new embedding of workflow tasks into the suite task overview, you can now access all your SAP Signavio Process Governance tasks directly within the suite.

As an administrator or frequent workflow user, you can now access all your SAP Signavio Process Governance tasks directly from the suite task overview. This new micro-frontend integration replaces the previous iFrame setup and delivers a seamless, native experience across the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite.

You‚Äôll be able to view, filter, and manage tasks in one unified location ‚Äî eliminating app switching, improving visibility, and creating a smoother user experience across the suite. 

Figure 1: Embedding workflow tasks into the suite task overview

Start the EnableNow step-by-step tutorial for this capability for end users

Important for administrators:
If you haven‚Äôt completed the setup yet, please follow the guide to enable the new SAP Signavio Process Governance Tasks interface: Provisioning for SAP Signavio Process Governance Suite Tasks.
This step ensures task access in SAP Signavio Collaboration Hub continues without interruption.

Navigate large task lists more smoothly

The improvement of pagination consistency helps you move through large task lists with greater stability and predictability.

If you handle large numbers of workflow tasks, you‚Äôll notice that moving between pages is now smoother and more predictable. This improvement brings consistent pagination behavior across the SAP Signavio Process Governance interface, giving you a more stable and intuitive navigation experience.

EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for modelers

Wave 2 ‚Äì November 25, 2025

Automate file handling with Microsoft SharePoint

The new workflow action for Microsoft SharePoint ‚Äì Copy file lets you automate document management between SAP Signavio Process Governance and Microsoft SharePoint.

You can now automate file management between SAP Signavio Process Governance and Microsoft SharePoint. As a modeler or administrator, you can configure a new workflow action that automatically copies files within Microsoft SharePoint ‚Äî reducing manual steps and ensuring documents are handled securely and consistently.

This enhancement helps you maintain governance compliance, simplify document management, and minimize the chance of manual errors in your workflows.

Figure 2: Workflow action: Microsoft SharePoint ‚Äì Copy file

EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for administrators
EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for modelers

Streamline collaboration with new Jira workflow actions

Two new capabilities ‚Äî workflow actions for Jira integration ‚Äî let you create new Jira issues or add comments to existing ones directly within SAP Signavio Process Governance.

With this enhancement, you can now connect SAP Signavio Process Governance directly with Jira, making it faster and easier to collaborate between business and IT teams.

You can create new Jira issues or add comments to existing ones directly within your workflows ‚Äî no system switching or scripting required. These guided, no-code actions reduce manual effort, ensure consistent issue handling, and keep all relevant updates visible in one place.

Figure 3: Workflow actions for Jira integration ‚Äì Create and add comments to Jira issues

EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for administrators
EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for modelers 

Model with greater precision and visibility

The new zoom functionality in the workflow editor allows you to focus on details or step back to see the full workflow.

As a modeler, you can now zoom in and out directly in the SAP Signavio Process Governance editor. This makes it easier to focus on details when refining a process or step back to see the entire flow in context.

You‚Äôll gain better visibility, smoother navigation, and a faster modeling experience ‚Äî consistent with the look and feel across other SAP Signavio solutions.

Figure 4: Zoom in and out of workflows with ease in the editor

EnableNow tutorial coming soon for this capability for modelers

In summary

The November 2025 release brings meaningful improvements to SAP Signavio Process Governance, giving you more control, visibility, and efficiency in how you manage workflows and collaborate across teams.

From a unified task overview and consistent interface experience to powerful new automation options with Microsoft SharePoint and Jira, these capabilities help you and your organization work smarter, stay aligned, and deliver business transformation faster.

If you have questions, feedback, or suggestions about these updates, we‚Äôd love to hear from you ‚Äî your input helps us continue improving SAP Signavio Process Governance to support your transformation journey.

Explore More

Discover all the capabilities released with the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite ‚Äì November 2025 Product Release and learn how these innovations help your organization connect insights to action, improve collaboration, and accelerate business transformation.

entry.title: SAP Signavio November 2025 Release: SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence
entry.content:
The latest November release in the area of Process Analysis & Mining marks a major leap in how your organization can access, analyze, and act on its process data.

Following highly successful beta programs, the AI-Assisted Process Analyzer is soon to be generally available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, featuring two powerful capabilities: text to insights and text to widget, that make process exploration truly conversational. Business users can now ask questions in natural language to uncover automated insights or instantly generate visualizations, simplifying complex analysis and accelerating time to value.
Complementing these AI-driven enhancements, this release also delivers seamless, large-scale data replication via SAP Datasphere, enabling direct, reliable, and continuous extraction of process-relevant data from SAP ERP systems into SAP Signavio Process Intelligence.

To top it off, we are bringing Variant Explorer, a staple of SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, to SAP Signavio Process Insights, enabling you to drill down on your processes with more transparency than ever.
And that‚Äôs just the beginning ‚Äî this release includes several additional innovations designed to deepen insights, boost collaboration, and enhance your overall analytics experience.

Keep reading to discover even more details of what this release brings.

SAP Signavio Process Intelligence

Replicate Data Seamlessly from SAP Systems with SAP Datasphere

Unlock faster, more reliable access to your process data. With direct data replication via SAP Datasphere, your organization can now seamlessly capture and transfer process-relevant data from SAP ECC and SAP S/4HANA systems into SAP Signavio Process Intelligence.

This capability ensures rapid and continuous data availability for process mining, backed by a robust change data capture (CDC) engine for up-to-date insights and comprehensive monitoring for full transparency.

Gain dependable data extraction at scale, leverage proven ABAP tools like DMIS and SLT, and connect SAP systems of various versions‚Äîall without additional add-ons.

From extraction to insight: faster, easier, and more reliable than ever.

Mass extraction of SAP data with SAP Datasphere replication flows

 Click here to start a step-by-step enable now tutorial for this feature.

Build the Visuals You Need ‚Äî Just by Asking

You no longer need to be a data expert to create the visualizations that bring your processes to life. With the AI-assisted process analyzer, text to widget, soon generally available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, you can simply describe what you want to see ‚Äî and let AI do the rest.

Ask a question in natural language, and the system instantly creates a widget that matches your query. Whether you‚Äôre exploring process performance, tracking key metrics, or comparing dimensions, you can now build the exact view you need in seconds, all without relying on technical know-how or specialized training.

This capability makes process analysis more intuitive and accessible than ever. It empowers non-technical business users to explore data confidently, speeds up time to value, and frees analysts to focus on deeper insights. With AI-assisted process analyzer, text to widget, interacting with your process data feels as natural as having a conversation ‚Äî and your dashboard becomes a living workspace for discovery.

This feature will be released mid-December.
AI-assisted process analyzer, text to widget

 Click here to start a step-by-step enable now tutorial for this feature.

Ask a Question, Get an Insight ‚Äî Instantly
But widgets isn‚Äôt all that AI-assisted process analyzer has to offer with this release. With the AI-Assisted process analyzer, text to insights, soon generally available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, business users can simply ask a question in natural language and receive relevant, automated insights in return. No dashboards to configure, no data models to understand, just a straightforward way to explore your processes and uncover what really drives performance.

This capability is designed to make process mining accessible to everyone, not just experts. It helps you define the focus of your analysis ‚Äî like key KPIs, timeframes, or process dimensions ‚Äî and instantly provides tailored insights aligned with your business goals. Whether you‚Äôre investigating inefficiencies or validating improvements, you can go from question to answer in seconds.

By lowering the barrier to analysis, AI-Assisted process analyzer, text to insights accelerates time to value, empowers business users to make informed decisions faster, and allows analysts to dedicate more time to complex exploration. It‚Äôs a smarter, simpler way to turn curiosity into clarity ‚Äî powered by AI, directly within your process data.

This feature will be coming mid-December.

AI-assisted process analyzer, text to insights

Click here to start a step-by-step enable now tutorial for this feature.

Simplify event mapping with AI

Manually aligning hundreds of events to BPMN models is time-consuming ‚Äî especially when names vary across languages or formats. With the new AI-Assisted process analyzer, event matching (Beta) in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, you can now automatically map events to model activities, even when they don‚Äôt match perfectly.

This intelligent feature understands abbreviations, typos, and multilingual labels, saving you valuable time while improving mapping accuracy. Plus, it learns from previous mappings to make future analyses even faster and more precise.
This feature will be coming mid-December.
AI-assisted process analyzer, event matching

Enrich Your Process Data Dynamically with Calculated Attributes

With Calculated Attributes in Interactive Mode, analysts can now extend and refine their process data directly within SAP Signavio Process Intelligence ‚Äî no ETL changes or data reloads required. This capability allows you to create new attributes on top of existing event logs, embedding business logic that can be certified once and reused across processes, views, widgets, and filters.

By decoupling enrichment from the data pipeline, process analysts gain a shorter feedback loop and greater flexibility to experiment, refine, and tailor analyses to their organization‚Äôs needs ‚Äî all without waiting for engineering support. The result: faster insights, more consistent data, and a single point of truth that can be confidently shared across teams.

Visually differentiated and easy to manage, calculated attributes can be added, reused, and dragged directly into measures and dimensions, empowering both technical and business users to shape their data with precision and speed.

Calculated attributes in interactive mode

SAP Signavio Process Insights

Instantly Discover Where You Stand: Benchmarks at a Glance
Finding out how your processes perform compared to the industry just became easier. With the new benchmark pop-up view in SAP Signavio Process Insights, process owners can now instantly see which Process Performance Indicators and Performance Factors have external benchmarks available ‚Äî directly within their analysis view.

Instead of manually searching through lists or switching between tabs, users can now access industry benchmark details right on top of their process flow or indicator overview. This seamless, in-context visibility helps identify promising areas for improvement faster and supports data-driven prioritization for optimization initiatives.

With benchmark data now just a click away, understanding your process performance in context has never been more effortless.

Improve Discoverability of Industry Benchmarks

 

Track Progress Over Time with Expanded Trendlines

Understanding how your process performance evolves over time is key to driving meaningful transformation. With the expanded availability of trendlines in SAP Signavio Process Insights, process owners and transformation leaders can now visualize changes for an even broader range of Process Performance Indicators, including those related to master data and customizing configuration.

This enhancement helps you spot trends, monitor improvements, and identify where progress may be slowing, offering a more holistic view of your ongoing transformation. By clearly communicating performance progress to stakeholders, teams can make data-driven decisions faster and maintain focus on what truly drives impact.

Trendlines now make it easier than ever to turn continuous monitoring into continuous improvement.

Trendlines for Usage Process Performance Indicators

 Click hereto start a step-by-step enable now tutorial for this feature.

Keep Value Tracking Seamless with Editable Baseline Periods

Managing transformation projects mid-stream just got easier. The enhanced baseline editing feature in Value Analysis now allows you to set or adjust the baseline period up to one year in the past when updating a value case.

This flexibility lets teams create or modify value cases for initiatives already in progress while maintaining all previously tracked value realization. There‚Äôs no need to restart measurement or lose historical data ‚Äî reporting remains consistent and uninterrupted.

With this enhancement, you can continue tracking value seamlessly, ensuring accurate progress measurement throughout every stage of your transformation journey.

Value Analysis - Support change of Baseline period in value cases

 Click here to start a step-by-step enable now tutorial for this feature.

Explore How Your Processes Really Run with the Variant Explorer Widget

Soon generally available in SAP Signavio Process Insights, the Variant Explorer Widget offers a new, interactive way to understand process execution. Embedded directly in the Process Flow page, it lets you explore different process variants, filter by blockers or performance drivers, and visualize how variations affect outcomes ‚Äî all in a single, integrated view. This capability helps you spot inefficiencies faster, uncover optimization opportunities, and gain deeper, execution-based insights into how your processes truly perform.

This feature will be coming mid-December.

Variant Explorer Widget in SAP Signavio Process Insights

Want to know more about this release? Check out the highlight blog post and see what else we prepared for this release over the entire SAP Signavio Transformation Suite!

We are looking forward to seeing you on the SAP Signavio Community to share feedback, questions and discuss with your peers! This is your space!

Please feel free to share your questions around the release or feedback in the comments with us. You can also reach out to us via the SAP Signavio Community or alternatively watch our Release Webcast on Demand.

entry.title: SAP Signavio value accelerators: what‚Äôs new in the November release
entry.content:
Delivering transformation at speed requires both clarity and precision. This latest release of SAP Signavio value accelerators empowers transformation leaders, process consultants, and business excellence teams to align with SAP best practices, optimize operations, and drive measurable business outcomes. 

From enriched process design and standardization content for SAP solutions and industry value scenarios to powerful new dashboards within the process landscape analysis, this release provides you the tools to accelerate fit-to-standard assessments, improve decision-making, and unlock deeper insights across end-to-end business processes. Whether you‚Äôre harmonizing operations, optimizing performance, or guiding enterprise transformation, SAP Signavio enables you to deliver value faster, at scale and with confidence. 

Read on to explore what‚Äôs new for this November: 

 

ERP & Business Transformation 

Process design and standardization for SAP solutions: SAP Master Data Governance, SAP Marketing Cloud, Fieldglass Vendor Management System, S/HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, SAP customer experience and SAP Secure operations 

SAP Signavio now empowers transformation leaders and process consultants to ensure alignment with best practices for SAP Solutions while effectively modeling ‚Äúto be‚Äù processes. With this value accelerator, your users can leverage SAP best-practice process models to accelerate fit-to-standard assessments, enhance process understanding, and support a smooth transition utilizing SAP Signavio Process Modeler. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Adherence to target processes dashboard within process landscape analysis (plug-and-gain approach) 

Designed for transformation and process excellence leaders managing ERP transformations, the adherence to target processes dashboard helps balance harmonization and localization by defining a target of desired process variants and then measures deviations from the target across systems and organizational units by using SAP Signavio Process Intelligence in the process landscape analysis (plug-and-gain approach). 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Additional content for the process landscape analysis (plug-and-gain approach) 

Transformation leaders seeking deeper, more accurate insights into business processes and transaction usage can now benefit from this dashboard, which supports ERP transformation prioritization and SAP system optimization by delivering precise benchmarking, identifying critical process steps, analyzing performance, and visualizing preferred process variants through BPMN diagrams. Leveraging intuitive dashboards and guided widgets, it empowers users to make informed decisions that enhance ERP transformation success and overall SAP system utilization. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Process design and standardization content for industry value scenarios: field service excellence, automotive JIT integration and intelligent meter-to-cash, industry specific model company content for S/4HANA 

For transformation leaders and process consultants aiming to align operations with SAP best practices, this value accelerator speeds up fit-to-standard assessments, deepens process understanding, and supports seamless transformation using SAP Signavio Process Modeler. By leveraging predefined business process models aligned with SAP industry value scenarios, it provides structured guidance and reusable assets that streamline end-to-end process implementation across SAP products and services. This ensures consistency, reduces project complexity, and enhances transformation outcomes across key Lines of Business. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Process design and standardization SAP Intelligent Enterprise Solutions content for idea to market and plan to fulfill 

Enable transformation leaders and process consultants to help ensure alignment with best practices for the end-to-end scenarios of Plan to Fulfill and Idea to Market from the SAP Intelligent Enterprise. The best-practice business process models from SAP can accelerate fit-to-standard assessments, enhance process understanding, and support a smooth transformation utilizing SAP Signavio Process Modeler. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Supply Chain 

Process flows analyzing shipping and receiving in SAP Extended Warehouse Management 

SAP Signavio Process Insights now enables warehouse managers to gain clear visibility into shipping and receiving activities within SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM). Users can now analyze shipping and receiving flows from activity creation to transportation unit checkout, identify blockers and bottlenecks that may impact lead times and operational efficiency and understand process performance to take timely corrective actions and improve overall warehouse operations. 

This update provides warehouse managers with comprehensive transparency, helping them minimize delays, optimize operations, and ensure smoother yard processes. 

 

Finance 

Identify improvement potential for invoice to pay in SAP ERP Central Component and SAP S/4HANA 

Designed for finance managers and account payable team leads, this value accelerator, available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, gives a clear starting point to improve payment performance by revealing missed cash discounts, inefficient payment timing, and areas for savings within the invoice-to-pay process. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Financial efficiency and cost savings for invoice to pay in SAP ERP Central Component and SAP S/4HANA 

Finance managers and account payable team leads can also benefit from this value accelerator, available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, which delivers actionable insights to capture cash discounts, optimize payment timing, and boost savings while strengthening supplier relationships and enhancing working capital. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Procurement 

Improve sourcing performance in SAP Ariba 

As a procurement excellence or transformation leader facing limited supplier participation and lengthy cycle times this value accelerator for SAP Signavio Process Intelligence highlights potential root causes for not successfully completed sourcing projects, low supplier participation or extended process cycle times. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Improvement opportunity dashboard to increase use of best possible and negotiated net prices 

Designed for procurement excellence and transformation leaders, this dashboard, available in SAP Signavio Process Insights highlights patterns, root causes and correction recommendations of not using best contract prices through targeted recommendations which help pinpoint concrete savings potential. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Improvement opportunity dashboard to increase usage of negotiated purchasing contracts 

Designed for procurement excellence and transformation leaders can now benefit from this dashboard, available in SAP Signavio Process Insights, which highlights patterns, root causes and correction recommendations of not using contract commitments through targeted correction recommendations, leading directly to systematically increase contract consumption. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Conclusions 

The latest SAP Signavio release continues to strengthen how organizations plan, execute, and optimize transformation initiatives. With expanded process design and standardization content for SAP solutions and industry value scenarios, new dashboards for adherence to target processes, and enhanced analytics across ERP, Finance, Procurement, and Supply Chain, this release delivers the clarity and precision needed to accelerate transformation success. 

By combining SAP best-practice process models with powerful insights from SAP Signavio Process Intelligence and Process Insights, transformation leaders can more effectively align strategy with execution, identify high-impact opportunities, and drive measurable outcomes. From fit-to-standard assessments to continuous performance improvement, SAP Signavio empowers organizations to transform with confidence. 

To check out all the new accelerators mentioned in this blog post, access the value accelerator library, which is embedded into SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite. Find the value accelerator library in the side panel of SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub and get started today. 

 

If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about the rest of the SAP Signavio solutions, check out the blog posts below:

 

  • SAP Signavio November 2025 Release Highlights   
  • Process Analysis and Mining   
  • Process and Journey Modeling 
  • New AI capabilities and enhancements   
  • Process Transformation Management and Collaboration   
  • Process Governance

entry.title: A New Era of Process Management and Transformation: Joule and Joule Agents in SAP Signavio
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs business landscape, where efficiency and intuitive user experiences are more critical than ever, SAP Signavio is constantly embedding new generative AI capabilities into its process mining, modeling, and transformation management solutions. These innovations can dramatically accelerate and simplify the way you drive transformation. 

With the upcoming general availability of Joule in SAP Signavio solutions and the introduction of new Joule Agents, SAP Signavio is also making significant advancements towards conversational process management. As a user, you can work more efficiently and productively by simply describing your ideas, asking questions, or instructing Joule on what to do.

Importantly, SAP Signavio is not only developing agents for its own solutions but is also committed to helping you deploy and manage AI agents - whether from SAP, SAP Signavio, or third-party providers.

New Joule Agents : Beta Program Starting December 2025

Two Joule Agents have been introduced with the November release, enabling users to automate repetitive tasks, accelerate content discovery, and enhance user onboarding. These agents leverage agentic AI to help process owners and analysts reduce information overload and focus on decision-making, while new users benefit from a smoother start.

  • Process Content Recommender Agent: This agent reasons over thousands of process best practices - both from SAP and custom process models - to answer user questions and provide tailored process content recommendations. For example, a process owner aiming to improve procurement could ask, ‚ÄúHow can I improve procurement?‚Äù The agent would then deliver a curated list of relevant process models, KPIs, accelerators, and suggested strategies to adopt.

New Joule Agent: Process Content Recommender Agent‚Äã ‚Äì Sneak Peek

  • Workspace Administration Agent: This agent supports faster onboarding for process modeling and process mining analysis by handling administrator requests to enroll multiple users with the correct licenses, roles, and access levels. The agent streamlines the enrollment process, providing immediate and appropriate access so new users and process experts can start engaging with SAP Signavio solutions, while administrative staff can focus on more complex tasks.

New Joule Agent: Workspace Administration Agent ‚Äì Sneak Peek

The new Joule Agents deliver an enhanced user experience, consistent governance across workspaces, faster adoption of SAP Signavio solutions, and improved operational efficiency.

Customers interested in joining the beta program can contact their SAP Signavio account executive or customer success partner.

Joule : General Availability (GA) in January 2026

Joule in SAP Signavio is set to debut in January 2026 following a successful Early Adopter Care (EAC) program. The initial release will include 40+ selected skills across three primary use cases, with additional capabilities added monthly:

  • Informational use cases: Joule acts as an intelligent assistant, helping users understand how to perform specific tasks. Key new features include a page explainer for instant on-screen guidance and the ability to generate textual comparisons of processes.
  • Navigational use cases: Joule simplifies content navigation within SAP Signavio Process Intelligence and guides users through the SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub to access assets such as process models, journey models, and value accelerators.
  • Transactional use cases: Joule enables users to perform actions conversationally, such as creating and deleting assets within the Process Transformation Suite, including process variants and journey models.

As the January release draws near, be sure to keep an eye out for updates on how to activate Joule in your workspace. Detailed activation guidance will be shared on the SAP Help Portal closer to release.

Supporting AI Agent Excellence from discovery to scale 

SAP Signavio is not only focused on developing agents for its own solutions but is also committed to helping organizations deploy AI agents - whether from SAP, SAP Signavio, or third-party providers. Agentic AI holds the promise of transforming companies, boosting efficiency, and streamlining daily tasks. However, this transformative shift raises important questions: Where can AI agents deliver the most value? Which processes benefit most? And can these agents be trusted?

SAP Signavio solutions are designed to address these challenges by providing clarity, focus, and strong governance for AI agent implementations. No matter where you are on your AI agent maturity journey - from initial exploration to scaling agents across the organization, SAP Signavio can help. Our capabilities include:

  • Discover and analyze: Understand where it is best to deploy agents
  • Build and deploy: Build or help the builder by infusing agents with the right process context to act
  • Mine and improve: Once the right guardrails and rules are set, help ensure agents behave properly
  • Manage and scale:  Measure the outcomes and value of agents for long-term success

Read more: Unleashing the Full Potential of AI Agents with SAP Signavio

Conclusion

The upcoming release of Joule (January 2026) and the new Joule Agents available through the beta program promise a more intuitive and actionable user experience. Whether your organization is adopting AI agents from SAP Signavio, other SAP solutions, or third-party vendors, SAP Signavio is ready to assist. We are committed to helping you navigate the complexities of AI agent deployment with clarity, focus, and robust governance.

Want to know more about this release? Check out the highlight blog post covering key innovations across entire the SAP Signavio Process Transformation suite.

entry.title: SAP Signavio November 2025 Product Release - Process Transformation Management and Collaboration
entry.content:
We‚Äôre thrilled to bring you the latest innovations in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager designed to help you uncover high-value initiatives faster and drive meaningful transformation with confidence. This release focuses on boosting speed, intelligence, and alignment so you can move from strategy to value effortlessly.

Let‚Äôs dive in! üëá

 

AI-Assisted Transformation Advisory, Initiative Builder

Instantly turn complex business documents into actionable transformation opportunities. With the new AI-Assisted Transformation Advisory, Initiative Builder, you can simply upload your strategic reports, operational reviews, or financial statements, and let us do the heavy lifting. This capability inside SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager automatically extracts and identifies key challenges and translates them into well-defined initiatives with detailed recommendations. You are then able to explore and select the most relevant and impactful initiative to pursue.

This feature accelerates decision-making, saves valuable resources, and ensures every transformation initiative is directly connected to your company strategy and goals.

No more sifting through lengthy PDFs or slide decks but only clear, value-driven transformation initiatives aligned to your strategic goals. This feature accelerates decision-making that keeps your transformation moving forward.

 

AI-Assisted Insights Description Generator 

Say goodbye to manual writing and hello to clarity! Our new AI-Assisted Insights Description Generator helps you to create polished, business-friendly descriptions in seconds. It ensures your insights are clear, consistent, and easy to communicate, and act upon, while making collaboration smoother across teams.

Click here to start the step-by-step tutorial for this feature

 

Link assets to initiatives

Keep everything you need in one place and no more hunting for links or files. You can now link all types of assets such as dashboards, documents, systems, external link and more, directly to your initiatives. By consolidating everything in one structured location in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager, teams can drive transformation initiatives faster, maintain context across stakeholders, and eliminate time lost searching for information across multiple solutions. Transformation just got a lot more organized!

 

API: Insights & Initiatives (Beta)‚Äã

Connect your ecosystem, your way. With the new Transformation Manager API (Beta), you can now integrate SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager with your existing systems ‚Äî creating and retrieving insights and initiatives from any external source. Here‚Äôs what that means for you:

  • Consolidate: Bring all insights and initiatives into one trusted view.
  • Decide Smarter: Enrich initiatives with full data context and source information.
  • Stay Transparent: Keep stakeholders aligned with a holistic view of transformation activities.
  • Stay Flexible: Fit seamlessly into your existing IT landscape with no disruption, just connection. 

For more information on this beta program, please reach out to Diana Veit

 

SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub

We‚Äôre excited to roll out our latest features in the SAP Signavio Collaboration Hub, designed to make your process management more intuitive, efficient, and collaborative than ever before. With the November 2025 release, we're introducing two key features that will significantly enhance your experience: Role-based process opverview and attachments in comments. Here‚Äôs how these powerful tools can streamline and enrich your workflows:  

Let‚Äôs dive in! üëá 

 

Role-based process overview 

Navigating through endless processes and data can often be overwhelming. That's why we're introducing the role-based process overview. This new feature personalizes your interaction with the SAP Signavio Collaboration Hub based on your specific role. 

Designed specifically for Process Citizens and Process Owners, the Role-Based Process Overview feature makes navigating content a breeze. Automatically uncover resources pertinent to your role by selecting them from the built-in dictionary and watch as tailored processes and activities populate in the My Process Overview panel on your home page. 

What you can get out of it: 

  • Personalized Experience: View the information that matters most to you. By spotlighting content that is contextually relevant, you can avoid missing out on important information that is critical to your role. 
  • Time Savings: This feature eliminates the need for tedious manual searches or filtering. Access what you need quickly and effortlessly, allowing you to focus more on executing tasks and decisions effectively. 
  • Reduced Administrative Tasks: Automated role-specific views and access paths significantly cut down the time spent on manual configuration, thus simplifying administrative duties.  

 

Explore More 

These highlights are just the beginning. Explore the full list of new features across the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite and discover how they can help you boost strategy to execution, democratize and achieve deep process insights with AI and process mining to drive operational excellence in this blog.

If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about the rest of the SAP Signavio solutions, check out the blog posts below: 

  • Process Analysis and Mining
  • Process and Journey Modeling
  • New AI capabilities and enhancements
  • Process Governance
  • Value Accelerators

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process and Journey Modeling: what's new in the November release
entry.content:
SAP Signavio delivers significant advancements in usability, accuracy, and integration, empowering organizations to accelerate process modeling and improve end-to-end process management. The innovations listed below enable your process modelers to efficiently transform complex, text-based documentation into BPMN-compliant diagrams, establish seamless links with dictionary items, and maintain alignment across connected systems such as SAP Cloud ALM.  

With extended input capabilities, interactive visualization, enhanced synchronization control, and expanded language support, this November 2025 release reinforces SAP Signavio‚Äôs commitment to driving process excellence, transparency, and global collaboration. Together, these enhancements streamline operations, reduce manual effort, and enable organizations to make data-driven process improvements with greater confidence and precision. 

Here is a summary of what the new November release brings to you: 

 

AI-assisted process modeler enhancements 

  • Usability improvements 

When working with complex diagrams that contain recurring data objects, activities, or IT systems, it can be challenging to pinpoint which specific element in the diagram corresponds to a given recommendation in the table. This often causes confusion and slows down the dictionary linking process. 

This enhancement solves this by providing instant visual feedback, allowing process modelers to clearly see the connection between dictionary recommendations and the AI-generated process model. The result is a faster, smoother modeling experience that accelerates model enrichment and makes navigating even extensive lists of dictionary matches effortless and intuitive. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature.

 

  • Dictionary integration enhancements 

Accelerate your process modeling by transforming textual descriptions into Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) diagrams that seamlessly connect to your existing dictionary items. With this enhanced capability, you can now link AI-generated diagrams directly to custom dictionary categories, ensuring alignment across all repository elements.  

This evolution not only reduces manual effort but also enhances consistency, allowing your modelers to focus on deeper analysis and continuous improvement. By automatically linking IT systems, organizational units, and other dictionary items, the feature improves standardization and ensures more accurate, cohesive models throughout your process landscape. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

  • Increased accuracy with extended input 

Valuable process knowledge is often buried within lengthy, context-rich documents such as user manuals, regulatory filings, or detailed operational reports. Extracting and modeling this information manually can be tedious, error-prone, and a major barrier to using existing documentation for process improvement.  

Process modelers can now convert extensive process documentation directly into BPMN-compliant diagrams. The upgraded capability supports significantly longer texts and delivers more accurate, ready-to-use models, minimizing the need for manual rework. Modelers can now capture complex, end-to-end workflows in a single step and gain immediate clarity on process triggers and outcomes through automatically generated BPMN-standard start and end events. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Synchronize any revision of SAP Signavio process model to SAP Cloud ALM 

Process managers can now synchronize any revision of an SAP Signavio process model to SAP Cloud ALM, expanding flexibility and control in process lifecycle management. Previously, only the latest revision of a process model could be synced. With this enhancement, users can select and synchronize any revision, whether older or newer than the one currently available in SAP Cloud ALM. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Indicate synchronised process model revision to SAP Cloud ALM in SAP Signavio 

Process managers can now instantly identify the latest process model revision synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM, ensuring a clear and accurate understanding of your current process landscape. This update provides full transparency, empowering teams to make informed decisions on the next steps with confidence. With real-time visibility into process revisions, SAP Signavio helps organizations stay aligned, agile, and fully in control of their process management lifecycle. 

Click here to start a step-by-step EnableNow tutorial for this feature. 

 

Migration from the classic connector to the new business process model connector 

We are excited to announce the latest feature for SAP Signavio and SAP Solution manager integration: the migration from the classic connector to the new business process model connector. This feature is specifically designed for our customers who have previously utilized the classic connector productively. The new feature facilitates a seamless transition to the new version of the connector, while delivering enhanced functionality. The classic connector support and mainstream maintenance will continue until the end of March 2026. SAP recommends migrating to the new connector, business process model connector for SAP Signavio solution, before this date for uninterrupted service. 

Using the migration feature in the new connector you will benefit from: seamless migration of data mapping, preserving essential configuration and moving of your synchronised data mapping to the new connector; intuitive user interface to manage the migration with comprehensive logs; flexible migration control, allowing users to review, adjust or accept migration results before continuing with standard synchronization via the new connector. 

Business process model connector for SAP Signavio solutions roadmap is complete as of October 2025 and no new feature are planned to be delivered. Support and maintenance follows SAP Solution Manager 7.2 strategy: 

  • Mainstream maintenance: until the end of December 2027 
  • Extended maintenance: until the end of December 2030 

External roadmap link 

 

Content language support for Vietnamese and Bahasa 

SAP Signavio now enables teams in Vietnam and Indonesia to create, view, and share process content in Vietnamese and Bahasa, ensuring correct characters, currencies, and number formats across Process Manager, Collaboration Hub, exports, and reports. This update strengthens content accuracy and regulatory compliance, allowing global teams to collaborate seamlessly in their native languages while meeting local documentation standards. With native-language support, SAP Signavio makes process management more accessible, precise, and globally aligned than ever before. 

 

View decision tables in collaboration hub for improved transparency 

SAP Signavio Collaboration Hub users are now able to preview decision tables alongside process content within the Hub, providing a clear view of decision logic without switching tools or views. With this update, your users can access decision tables directly alongside other process content for immediate context and clarity. 

This capability enhances collaboration, ensuring team alignment through shared visibility, and improves transparency, allowing stakeholders to review and understand decision-making processes on a centralized platform. 

 

Conclusions 

The November 2025 release underscores SAP Signavio‚Äôs ongoing commitment to empowering organizations with intelligent, AI-driven capabilities that simplify process management and enhance collaboration across the enterprise.  

By streamlining model enrichment, improving data consistency through enhanced dictionary integration, and providing greater transparency in process synchronization, SAP Signavio continues to enable your organization to work more efficiently, maintain alignment across systems, and drive continuous improvement. These enhancements represent a strategic evolution toward a more integrated, insight-driven approach to business transformation, helping enterprises remain agile, reduce complexity, and lead confidently in an increasingly dynamic environment. 

If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about the rest of the SAP Signavio solutions, check out the blog posts below:   

 

  • SAP Signavio November 2025 Release Highlights   
  • Process Analysis and Mining   
  • Value Accelerators 
  • New AI capabilities and enhancements   
  • Process Transformation Management and Collaboration   
  • Process Governance

entry.title: Re: HTML5 app not showing in BTP Cockpit After deployed
entry.content:
Hi,

I had a look at your setup and wanted to clarify a few points around the approuter configuration.

You‚Äôre currently configuring a standalone (unmanaged) approuter, whereas the managed approuter is usually the recommended option, unless there‚Äôs a specific technical need (for example, when you require custom authentication, routing logic, or integration with non-SAP services).

To help you compare both approaches, please review the following resources:

Managed Approuter Example (GitHub):
SAP Fiori Tools Sample ‚Äì Managed Approuter

SAP Blog: Differences Explained
Managed vs. Standalone Approuter (SAP Tech Bytes)

In your case, since your YAML file is set up for a standalone approuter, your HTML5 app is accessed through the dev space where the approuter was deployed ‚Äî the approuter essentially sits in front of your HTML5 content and handles the routing.

If your goal is a simpler, managed deployment, I‚Äôd suggest using the managed approuter approach instead. It‚Äôs easier to maintain, integrates seamlessly with SAP BTP services, and handles authentication and routing automatically.

I hope this clarifies things a bit. 

John

Thanks TA

entry.content:
